title: New Shepard suffers in-flight abort on uncrewed suborbital flight
summary: A problem with Blue Origin’s New Shepard suborbital vehicle caused an in-flight flight a minute after liftoff Sept. 12, causing a capsule filled with payloads but not people to fire its launch abort motor and parachute to a safe landing.

title: Firefly aiming for orbit on second Alpha demonstration flight
summary: With the goal of successfully reaching orbit, Firefly is set to launch FLTA002 – its second demonstration flight of the Alpha launch vehicle – on the mission dubbed “To The Black.” Launching from Space Launch Complex 2 West (SLC-2W) at the Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, the vehicle is now scheduled to lift off on Monday, Sept. 12 in a window from 3:00 to 7:00 PM PDT (22:00 to 02:00 UTC). Sunday’s launch attempt was scrubbed following an abort less than a minute before the opening of the window and subsequent delays throughout the window.

title: Startups to test advanced computing technology on lunar missions
summary: Like missions in low-Earth and geostationary orbit, deep space missions will require extensive computing capability.

title: Major operator consolidation is a long time coming
summary: Mergers between even small operators have been few and far between in an industry where nationalistic protectionism and unique regulations often inhibit deal-making.

title: Riding the consolidation wave
summary: A surge of mergers between major satellite operators is rippling through the broader commercial space industry, promising more change in what are already transformational times for the market.

title: Watch live: Blue Origin ready for uncrewed suborbital launch today
summary: Blue Origin is set to launch its New Shepard suborbital rocket from West Texas to space Monday, but this time it will fly without any human passengers. The booster and capsule will loft 36 payloads from research institutions and student organizations, half of which are funded by NASA. The launch window opens at 9:30 a.m. EDT (8:30 a.m. CDT; 1330 GMT).

title: Surging demand for satellite data services, Euroconsult forecast
summary: At a time of dramatic change in the satellite communications market, Euroconsult expects companies to expand revenues by introducing new services, attracting additional customers for existing services and cutting costs.

title: White House requests proposals for regulating novel commercial space activities
summary: The White House will ask federal agencies for their proposals for how to authorize and supervise emerging commercial space capabilities that don’t fit into current regulatory regimes.

title: KT SAT orders Koreasat 6A communications satellite from Thales
summary: Thales Alenia Space said Sept. 17 it has signed a contract to deliver a communications satellite for South Korea’s KT SAT in the fourth quarter of 2024.

title: Photos: Firefly’s second Alpha rocket raised on launch pad
summary: These photos show Firefly Aerospace’s second Alpha rocket as it was raised on its launch pad at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California on Sept. 10. Photographers captured these views on the eve of the rocket’s planned test flight carrying seven small satellites into orbit.
